net.jbasics.util

Class Str

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jbasics.util.Str

  • public final class Str
extends Object

    Set of String Convenience Methods

    Also contains some generic CharSequence (CharBuffer, Segment, String, StringBuffer, StringBuilder) methods.

    Version:
    2019-12-20
    Author:
    Rob Stoecklein

    • Method Detail

      • isNull

        public static boolean isNull(CharSequence charSequence)
        Determines if the given CharSequence is null or not. Probably don't need this method, but it's here for completeness. 
            Str.isNull(null)     = true
    Str.isNull("")       = false
    Str.isNull("foobar") = false

      • length

        public static int length(CharSequence charSequence)
        Determine the number of characters in the given CharSequence, or zero if null.

      • notNull

        public static String notNull(String str)
        If the given string is not null, simply return it. If it is null, return the empty string.

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty(CharSequence charSequence)

        Checks if a CharSequence is empty ("") or null.

            StringUtils.isEmpty(null)      = true
    StringUtils.isEmpty("")        = true
    StringUtils.isEmpty(" ")       = false
    StringUtils.isEmpty("bob")     = false
    StringUtils.isEmpty("  bob  ") = false
        Parameters:
        charSequence - the CharSequence to check, may be null
        Returns:
        true if the CharSequence is empty or null
        See Also:
        StringUtils.isEmpty(CharSequence)

      • notEmpty

        public static CharSequence notEmpty(CharSequence charSequence)
        If the given string is null or empty, return null, otherwise simply return it.

      • isBlank

        public static boolean isBlank(CharSequence charSequence)

        Checks if a CharSequence is empty (""), null or whitespace only.

        Whitespace is defined by Character.isWhitespace(char).

            Str.isBlank(null)      = true
    Str.isBlank("")        = true
    Str.isBlank(" ")       = true
    Str.isBlank("bob")     = false
    Str.isBlank("  bob  ") = false
        Parameters:
        charSequence - the CharSequence to check, may be null
        Returns:
        true if the CharSequence is null, empty or whitespace only
        See Also:
        StringUtils.isBlank(CharSequence)

      • hasValue

        public static boolean hasValue(CharSequence charSequence)
        The opposite of isBlank().

      • trim

        public static String trim(String str)

        Null-save way to remove a String's beginning and trailing whitespace.

            Str.trim(null)           = ""         // null
    Str.trim("")             = ""         // empty string
    Str.trim("abc")          = "abc"      // standard string
    Str.trim("\t x y z\r\n") = "x y z"    // removal of all leading and trailing whitespace
        Returns:
        String with all beginning and trailing whitespace removed, or the empty string if input is null

      • toLowerCase

        public static String toLowerCase(String str)
        Null-safe conversion of a String to all lower-case characters.
        Returns:
        String with all characters converted to lower-case, or the empty string if input is null

      • toUpperCase

        public static String toUpperCase(String str)
        Null-safe conversion of a String to all upper-case characters.
        Returns:
        String with all characters converted to upper-case, or the empty string if input is null

      • firstChar

        public static String firstChar(String str)
        Null-safe way to retrieve the first character in a String.

      • lastChar

        public static String lastChar(String str)
        Null-safe way to retrieve the last character in a String.

      • keepOnlyDigits

        public static String keepOnlyDigits(String input)
        Removes all characters in input string that are not digits [0 - 9].

      • removeConsecutiveChars

        public static String removeConsecutiveChars(String input,
                                            char dupeChar)
        Removes all consecutive occurences of the dupeChar. 
            Str.removeConsecutiveChars(null, ";")               = ""
    Str.removeConsecutiveChars("a;b;c", ";")            = "a;b;c"
    Str.removeConsecutiveChars(";ab;cd;;ef;;;gh;", ";") = ";ab;cd;ef;gh;"

      • removeConsecutiveSpaces

        public static String removeConsecutiveSpaces(String input)
        Removes all consecutive spaces from a string. 
            Str.removeConsecutiveSpaces(null)               = ""
    Str.removeConsecutiveSpaces("a b c")            = "a b c"
    Str.removeConsecutiveSpaces(" ab cd  ef   gh ") = " ab cd ef gh "

      • escapeNonPrintableChars

        public static String escapeNonPrintableChars(CharSequence input)
        Changes all non-printable characters to their printable equivalent. Code taken from org.apache.pzcommon.lang3.StringEscapeUtils. 
            Str.escapeNonPrintableChars(null)                                          = ""
    Str.escapeNonPrintableChars("Foo Fighters\r\n")                            = "Foo Fighters\\r\\n"
    Str.escapeNonPrintableChars("Hello\t What\r Are Youáˆ´ Doing\n?") = "Hello\\t What\\r Are\\u0003 You\\u1234 Doing\\n?"

      • split

        public static String[] split(String input,
                             String separator)
        Meant to take the place of String split() calls.
        Parameters:
        input - input text (optional)
        separator - separator string (not a regular expression!)

      • splitIntoArrayOfStrings

        public static String[] splitIntoArrayOfStrings(String input,
                                               String separator)
        Converts the provided text into an array of strings, separator specified. 
            Str.splitStringIntoArrayOfStrings(null, "\n")                       = []
    Str.splitStringIntoArrayOfStrings("", "\n")                         = [""]
    Str.splitStringIntoArrayOfStrings("abc", "\n")                      = ["abc"]
    Str.splitStringIntoArrayOfStrings(" abc\r\n def\r\n ghi\r\n", "\n") = ["abc", "def", "ghi"]  // whitespace is trimmed
        Parameters:
        separator - (not a regular expression)

      • parseIntoArrayOfStrings

        public static String[] parseIntoArrayOfStrings(String input)
        Converts a string of space-separated pieces into an array of strings. 
            Str.parseIntoArrayOfStrings(null)                     = []
    Str.splitStringIntoArrayOfStrings("")                 = []
    Str.splitStringIntoArrayOfStrings("  ")               = []
    Str.splitStringIntoArrayOfStrings(" abc ")            = ["abc"]
    Str.splitStringIntoArrayOfStrings(" abc    def ghi ") = ["abc", "def", "ghi"]  // multiple spaces are trimmed

      • splitIntoListOfStrings

        public static List<String> splitIntoListOfStrings(String input)
        Converts a comma-delimited string into a list of its component pieces. 
            Str.splitStringIntoListOfStrings(null, true)          = []                       // null
    Str.splitStringIntoListOfStrings("", true)            = []                       // empty string
    Str.splitStringIntoListOfStrings("abc,def,ghi", true) = ["abc", "def", "ghi"]    // standard list
    Str.splitStringIntoListOfStrings("a, b ,,d", true)    = ["a", "b", "", "d"]      // extra spaces and missing item, preserve empty
    Str.splitStringIntoListOfStrings("a, b ,,d", false)   = ["a", "b", "d"]          // extra spaces and missing item, do not preserve empty

      • splitIntoListOfStrings

        public static List<String> splitIntoListOfStrings(String input,
                                                  String separator)
        Converts a string of separator-delimited pieces into a list. (Same as above, except with the ability to define the separator) 
            Str.splitStringIntoListOfStrings(null, "#", true)          = []                      // null
    Str.splitStringIntoListOfStrings("", "@", true)            = []                      // empty string
    Str.splitStringIntoListOfStrings("abc:def:ghi", ":", true) = ["abc", "def", "ghi"]   // standard list
    Str.splitStringIntoListOfStrings("a; b ;;d", ";", true)    = ["a", "b", "", "d"]     // extra spaces and missing item, preserve empty
    Str.splitStringIntoListOfStrings("a; b ;;d", ";", false)   = ["a", "b", "d"]         // extra spaces and missing item, do not preserve empty
        Parameters:
        separator - (not a regular expression)

      • splitWithQuotes

        public static String[] splitWithQuotes(String input)
        Splits a string (typically command-line parameters) into its component parts, which are separated by spaces or double-quote characters. 
            Str.splitWithQuotes(null)                               = []
    Str.splitWithQuotes("")                                 = []
    Str.splitWithQuotes("   ")                              = []
    Str.splitWithQuotes("--param x15 -x 32")                = ["--param", "x15", "-x", "32"]
    Str.splitWithQuotes("I like the \"Foo Fighters\" band") = ["I", "like", "the", "Foo Fighters", "band"]
    Str.splitWithQuotes(I  also  like  \"'Rush and U2'\")   = ["I", "also", "like", "'Rush and U2'"]

      • areEqual

        public static boolean areEqual(String str1,
                               String str2)
        Determines if two strings are case-sensitive equal, including comparison for nulls.

      • areEqualIgnoreCase

        public static boolean areEqualIgnoreCase(String str1,
                                         String str2)
        Determines if two strings are case-insensitive equal, including comparison for nulls.

      • isValidIpAddress

        public static boolean isValidIpAddress(String ipAddress)
        Determines if the passed IP address is valid. It must have the form aaa.bbb.ccc.ddd, where each value is >=0 and <=255. 
            Str.isValidIPAddress("name", "201.43.255.7") = true
    Str.isValidIPAddress("name", "56.78.90.133") = true
    Str.isValidIPAddress("name", null)           = false
    Str.isValidIPAddress("name", "foobar")       = false
    Str.isValidIPAddress("name", "1.2.3.256")    = false
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - (optional)

      • isValidSubnetMask

        public static boolean isValidSubnetMask(String ipAddress)
        Determines if the passed IP address is a valid subnet mask. See: https://www.pantz.org/software/tcpip/subnetchart.html

      • isValidSSID

        public static boolean isValidSSID(String ssid)
        Determines if the passed SSID (Service Set Identifier) is valid. min length: 1 (limit should be 8, but have seen real SSIDs with fewer) max length: 32 valid chars: printable characters: 0x20-0x7e (32-126) [our limitation]

      • isValidPSK

        public static boolean isValidPSK(String psk)
        Determines if the passed PSK (Pre-Shared Key) is valid. min length: 8 max length: 63 valid chars: printable characters: 0x20-0x7e (32-126) [our limitation]

      • isValidFilename

        public static boolean isValidFilename(String filename)
        Determines if the passed string is a valid filename or not. min length: 1 max length: 63 [our limitation] can't begin or end with whitespace [our limitation] valid char range is 0x20-0x7e [our limitation] invalid chars: < > : " / \ | ? * [Windows' limitation] See: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/desktop/fileio/naming-a-file
